title.text: Detecting Figurative Word Occurrences Using Recurrent Neural Networks

abstractContent.text: The paper addresses the detection of figurative usage of words in English text.

entities.text: detection of figurative usage of words in English text

abstractContent.text: The chosen method was to use neural nets fed by pre-trained word embeddings.

The obtained results show that simple solutions, based on word embeddings only, are comparable to complex solutions, using additional information as a result of taggers or a psycholinguis-tic database.
This approach can be easily applied to other languages, even less-studied, for which we only have raw texts available.

introductionContent.text: Natural language is a very efficient way of communication.
To make the task of learning and remembering language easier, the same linguistic expression can have many different meanings, e.g. the nearest bank.
What is more, in spite of regular homonymy and polysemy, words or expressions can have a meaning that is different from all literal interpretations.
The latter phenomena, called figurative usage, allows for much more creative and rich communication, and makes it more effective, persuasive, and impactful.
It is very often used in poetry or literature, but is also quite frequent in everyday language.
Although figurative meanings are different from literal ones, there usually exists some linkage between both meanings which make metaphors comprehensive fora hearer/reader.
For example, when somebody says I am a rock we start to think about being hard and solid.
Thus, we can easily understand not just conventional figurative expressions which we already know, but also those that we read or hear for the first time.
The problem which we tried to solve was defined by the organizers of the Figurative Language NAACL Workshop shared task in which we took part as the ZIL-IPIPAN team.

entities.text: Figurative Language NAACL Workshop shared task

introductionContent.text: In this task, participants were supposed to label, in a given subset of VU Amsterdam Metaphor Corpus (, individual words which were used metaphorically.

As people are able to recognize metaphorical usage of a word based on the actual context, we decided to test to what degree it is possible to automatically recognize metaphorical word occurrence using only word embeddings.
